name: Sheraton Dallas Hotel

reviews.text: My son and I came to the Sheraton as part of the Snowball Express. The Sheraton donated rooms for all the families as well as the volunteers. The staff at the hotel was absolutely amazing and I could never thank them enough. The room was beautiful and spotless. I would recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to the Dallas area.
reviews.title: Absolutely Amazing

reviews.text: This was a great place to hold and attend a large conference. The touch screen computers throughout the Hotel were great to find places to eat and explore while I was visiting Dallas.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: hotel and staff are marvelous! I loved the view of the park and downtown from my room.
reviews.title: I will definitely stay on my next trip to Dallas

reviews.text: The rooms are great
reviews.title: Delightful Experience

reviews.text: -Starbucks coffee in your room everymorning
reviews.title: Not what I expected

reviews.text: Hotel was just too large for my comfort. I did not see any security or cameras in the hotel or especially in the parking garage which is easily accesible to anyone from the street.
reviews.title: Huge hotel with no security-felt unsafe.

reviews.text: The staff is very friendly and professional especially the front desk. Which I had to visit several times as my hotel key refused to work 3 straight days. Very frustrating. No maid service for 1 day which left us with no clean towels or toilet paper. Really unacceptable.
reviews.title: I would definitely stay there again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room with very spacious and the beds very comfortable. It's pet friendly. Easy access to DART light rail although I didn't use it as I rented a car. Parking is $10 daily.
reviews.title: My home away from Home

reviews.text: No free Wi-FI in the rooms, but it is in the business center.
reviews.title: A great place to stay when you are in Dallas

reviews.text: My family and I stayed for 4 days at this hotel for a sporting competition and we will be returning to Dallas next month. I will be making reservations at another hotel.
reviews.title: Great hotel with super friendly service

reviews.text: This hotel has too many good things going for it to be this bad: Clean rooms, fantastic gym, proximity to convention space and a very good lobby set-up for the business set. Made it all the more otherworldly when elevators that stopped working Thursday weren't fixed by Sunday; when false fire alarms go off at all hours, including 2 and 4 in the morning; when the concierge sends you to restaurants that are closed, or recommends places that aren't, frankly, that good; when you spend 10 minutes begging someone to let you out of the garage because your room key won't work; when they charge a criminal $15.95 for internet service on top of a $235 nightly rate; and so on, and so on. In a word: Overmatched. At least when the big show comes to town, a la the Super bowl.
reviews.title: Too good to be this bad

reviews.text: I first stayed at this hotel over a year ago and have visited at least another 7 or 8 times since on business. While I normally stay at Hilton properties I was recommended to stay here due to the proximity of where I was going to attend meetings. Now all I can say is that I look forward to each and every trip. The hotel had a huge renovation and is just gorgeous. The staff could not be more helpful. The rooms and amenities are wonderful. The fitness center is first rate. The DART train runs right outside so it is easy to take a train to any location you desire. If you have Concierge lounge access be sure to visit Jackie who runs the lounge on the 28th floor. She's wonderful and her positive attitude helped me start off many early morning in a much happier mood. The restaurant and lounge are great. Room services has always been top notch! Prices are typical of better hotels and they offer dinner buffets throughout the week for approx $20 which is not bad at all compared to local restaurants, etc.
reviews.title: This is my favorite hotel in Dallas

reviews.text: One of their features is a program where you can help save energy by foregoing room service for which you will get either 500 SPG points or a $5 voucher. I actually like this option a lot since I travel alone so for a 2-3 night stay have more than enough towels, etc.
reviews.title: Front-line staff great but???

reviews.text: Bottom line, I LOVE THIS PLACE!!!!
reviews.title: Nice hotel & conference area

reviews.text: Nice, huge complex. Front-line staff is great, stuffy management staff (bit of an edge, poor customer service) seemed to be more focus on the NFL group coming in for Super Bowl then us guest in the hotel now. hummmmmm great rooms, hot water......12 floor ice machine then up to the 14th ice machine out of service. Tip to upper ego staff. Chill!
reviews.title: The Sheraton Dallas really took care of us

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: -Good water pressure from the shower
reviews.title: Not Impressed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The recent upgrades to the Sheraton Dallas have made it a truly great place to stay. The new room decor as well as the stunning lobby and restaurant areas have stepped this hotel experience up a few notches. Most importantly, the beds are the most comfortable of any hotel in which we have stayed. When business or pleasure takes you to the downtown area, This is the hotel of choice.
reviews.title: A Great experience at this Landmark Dallas Hotel

reviews.text: I was really impressed with the overall experience. There was a huge event going on. The Dallas Margarita Ball... I heard there was an estimated 12,000 people in attendance. With all of that going on I was still able get around and have a great stay. I really like the upgrades in the rooms and the quality of the room was great for the money. The location was good for grabbing a cab and getting around town. Mckinney Ave was a great strip to hang out on.
reviews.title: The rooms are great!! Nothing better than feeling comfortable & at home.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Sheraton Dallas is my favorite place to stay in Dallas. It is always well-maintained, and the staff is exceptional. Employees bend over backward to meet your needs. My room is always what I have asked for and requests like early check-in have always been granted. The location is perfect if you need to be in the downtown area with quick and easy access to 75 Central Expressway, I-35, and I-45. From my experience, they also do a fantastic job holding major events.
reviews.title: My favorite place to stay in Dallas!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have attended the Dallas Margarita Ball, which is held in November at the Dallas Sheraton, for the past three years and have stayed overnight each year. This year was the best yet. There have been many renovations to the hotel and the improvements are noticeable and positive. The hotel is conveniently located near West End, where we visit when at this location.
reviews.title: Third and Best Stay Here
Hotel is so conviently located, well-maintained, and friendly.
reviews.text: Front desk service - outstanding

reviews.title: Great Place to Stay in Dallas when Traveling Alone
reviews.text: Club Room Hostess (and assoc. Host) - both amazing...they made our stay absolutely wonderful!!

reviews.title: Wouldn't board my dog here...
reviews.text: Concierge - knowledgable and extremely helpful

reviews.title: One bed's mattress smelled of urine.
reviews.text: Location is amazing

reviews.title: Huge room, understood why they say everything is big in US
reviews.text: Room met all our needs; however, thermostat didn't work for first two days

Of course it is very large (after all, this is Texas) with the service, cleanliness, and comfort you would expect of a high end hotel. The fitness center is far better than anything I have seen in properties of this kind. It is large and spacious with most of the free weights, circuit training machines, and cardio equipiment you would want. Yes, there are a few other things I would add but it certainly met my needs for a 3 day stay.
reviews.title: The fitness center is worth it

description: Sheraton Downtown Dallas Hotel offers warm hospitality, an accommodating environment, and vibrant location in the heart of the Arts and Financial district and just blocks from the Convention Center.
